entry.title: Fitness Vacation to Bali
entry.content:
üîóBali Fitness Vacation with Kris (11th - 18th October 2024)

On one casual day at the gym, I was talking to my gym trainer Kris: ‚ÄúHey Kris, I am thinking of taking a vacation and going somewhere to chill.‚Äù Kris said he hadn‚Äôt taken a vacation recently, so why not go somewhere together? That was the start of the plan.

Our initial idea was to pick Kuari Pass Trek or Hampta Pass Trek, but as we researched further, we realized that the cost and effort required for these treks were similar to doing a fitness vacation in Bali. Besides, Kris had done this twice before and promised me I would have a fun time. After looking at my work schedule, I decided to go the same day we planned it.

It was a six-and-a-half-day vacation. The broader agenda was to do three workouts a day, eat clean, and rest, which is exactly what we did.

üîóItinerary

üîóDay 1 - Friday, 11th October 2024

We landed at Bali DPS airport, took a taxi, and went straight to Sepeda Hostel Canggu, where we stayed for the entire trip. It was a fun and affordable hostel, costing around ‚Çπ11K for two people for seven days.

  • Had dinner at a nearby Korean BBQ restaurant serving unlimited meals.
  • Walked around the Canggu area to check out gyms we wanted to visit.
  • Ended the day with a protein smoothie and an Acai bowl at a nearby place.

üîóDay 2 - Saturday, 12th October 2024

  • Joined the Flowerboy Run, a 5K run starting from a nearby caf√©. The rough terrain made it challenging, and I couldn‚Äôt finish the entire run.
  • Went for our first session at Wanderlust Fitness Village. The Saturday workout was intense, with a mix of full-body barbell exercises and 800-meter runs in the sun. I gave up after the first round, but Kris powered through.
  • Protein shakes at Wanderlust were delicious, so I skipped lunch.
  • In the evening, had dinner at Milk & Madu, where I had a burger, and Kris opted for a large salad.

üîóDay 3 - Sunday, 13th October 2024

  • Early morning start for the Mt. Batur Hike, which involved climbing 1.7 km in about 2-2.5 hours to see a stunning sunrise near an active volcano.
  • Our companions were a couple from Gujarat; the husband gave up halfway and took a motorcycle ride up.
  • Kris and I had deep conversations while descending, discussing past adventures and life goals.
  • Learned about the opportunity to shoot an RPG at specific targets in Cambodia.

üîóDay 4 - Monday, 14th October 2024

  • Did two workouts at Wanderlust Fitness Village:
    • Early morning session with barbell exercises like cleans and jerks.
    • A second session mid-morning, which was equally intense.
  • Had breakfast at The BrunchClub Berawa, which served amazing food.
  • Spent the evening on a long walk and had dinner at a traditional Warung.
  • Participated in a beer pong game (without beer) organized by the hostel and won (beginners‚Äô luck)!

üîóDay 5 - Tuesday, 15th October 2024

  • Joined the Rise and Run running club, led by a Tasmanian lady. Started the run from Crate Caf√© and completed a 5K run.
  • Had breakfast at Avocado Factory, which served amazing avocado-based dishes.
  • Attended a Spin class at Zyn, followed by protein shakes at their caf√©.
  • Evening workout at Obsidian Gym, which had impressive equipment and a global crowd.
  • Dinner at Santorini Greek Restaurant.

üîóDay 6 - Wednesday, 16th October 2024

  • Morning full-body workout at Wanderlust Fitness Village, followed by a fantastic meal at Motion Caf√©.
  • Afternoon session at Canggu Studio, where Coach Douglass taught us Callisthenics.

üîóDay 7 - Thursday, 17th October 2024

  • No workouts planned. In the evening, Kris and I visited a nearby beach (because a trip to Bali without a beach visit would be incomplete).
  • Had dinner at a Canggu Superfood place, though it wasn‚Äôt as great as the other spots we tried.

üîóDay 8 - Friday, 18th October 2024

  • Bid farewell to Kris as he headed back to India.
  • I continued with my solo explorations in Bali.

üîóReflection

This trip was an incredible blend of fitness, adventure, and meaningful conversations. It was my first trek ever, and the bond I formed with Kris during this trip made it all the more special.
